revised_title: Kala Azar Epidemiology and Clinical Observations in Shantung, China
tldr: This article reports on the study of Kala Azar disease in Shantung, China, analyzing its incidence, age, and seasonal patterns based on hospital records and local information. The disease is found to be more prevalent in rural areas and has a longer duration in China compared to Indian cases. The study also highlights the importance of understanding the disease's epidemiology and its impact on affected communities.
